info.title: BambooHR API
info.description:
This is the majority of the API requests including some that are not documented.

http://www.bamboohr.com/api/documentation/

get.description: Get employee data by specifying a set of fields. This is suitable for getting basic employee information, including current values for fields that are part of a historical table, like job title, or compensation information. See the [fields](ref:metadata-get-a-list-of-fields) endpoint for a list of possible fields.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: The subdomain used to access BambooHR. If you access BambooHR at https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, then the companyDomain is "mycompany"

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: {fields} is a comma separated list of values taken from the official list of field names.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: {id} is an employee ID. The special employee ID of zero (0) means to use the employee ID associated with the API key (if any).

parameters.name: onlyCurrent
parameters.description: Setting to false will return future dated values from history table fields.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This endpoint can produce either JSON or XML.

403.description: if the API user does not have permission to see the requested employee.

404.description: if the employee does not exist.

post.description: Update an employee, based on employee ID. If employee is currently on a pay schedule syncing with Trax Payroll, or being added to one, the API user will need to update the employee with all of the following required fields for the update to be successful (listed by API field name): employeeNumber, firstName, lastName, dateOfBirth, ssn, gender, maritalStatus, hireDate, address1, city, state, country, employmentHistoryStatus, exempt, payType, payRate, payPer, location, department, and division.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: The subdomain used to access BambooHR. If you access BambooHR at https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, then the companyDomain is "mycompany"

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: {id} is an employee ID.

400.description: Provided JSON is bad or user is missing required fields.

403.description: If the user doesn't have perms to see the employee or the user doesn't have perms to update ANY of the requested fields.

404.description: If the employee to be updated doesn't exist.

409.description: If an employee field was given an invalid value

post.description: Add a new employee. New employees must have at least a first name and a last name. The ID of the newly created employee is included in the Location header of the response. Other fields can be included. Please see the [fields](ref:metadata-get-a-list-of-fields) endpoint. New Employees added to a pay schedule synced with Trax Payroll must have the following required fields (listed by API field name): employeeNumber, firstName, lastName, dateOfBirth, ssn, gender, maritalStatus, hireDate, address1, city, state, country, employmentHistoryStatus, exempt, payType, payRate, payPer, location, department, and division.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: The subdomain used to access BambooHR. If you access BambooHR at https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, then the companyDomain is "mycompany"

201.description: Additionally, an HTTP Location: header that points to the new API URL for the new employee will be returned.

Location.description: The URL to view the employee in the web app. The ID of the employee will be included.

400.description: If the posted XML or JSON is invalid or the minimum fields are not provided.

403.description: If the API user does not have permission to add an employee.

409.description: If an employee field was given an invalid value.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: The subdomain used to access BambooHR. If you access BambooHR at https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, then the companyDomain is "mycompany"

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This endpoint can produce either JSON or XML.

403.description: if the directory has not been shared company-wide.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: The subdomain used to access BambooHR. If you access BambooHR at https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, then the companyDomain is "mycompany"

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: {id} is an employee ID. The special employee ID of zero (0) means to use the employee ID associated with the API key (if any).

403.description: if the API user does not have permission to see the requested employee or the employee's files.

404.description: if no files are found for this employee.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: The subdomain used to access BambooHR. If you access BambooHR at https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, then the companyDomain is "mycompany"

400.description: if the posted XML is invalid or there was no category name given.

403.description: if the API user does not have permission to create employee categories.

500.description: there was an unknown server error.

post.description: Add a new Webhook. For more details or instructions you can refer to the [webhooks API tutorial](https://documentation.bamboohr.com/docs/webhooks-api-permission-based).

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: The subdomain used to access BambooHR. If you access BambooHR at https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, then the companyDomain is "mycompany"

monitorFields.description: A list of fields to monitor.

postFields.description: A list of fields to post to the webhook url. Field ID or alias: external name

additionalProperties.description: External name to post field to

url.description: The url the webhook should send data to (must begin with https://).

format.description: The format the webhook should use (json - default, form-encoded).

frequency.description: How often the webhook could fire.

hour.description: The hour to potentially fire (0-23, null to potentially fire every hour)

minute.description: The minute to potentially fire (0-59, null to potentially fire every minute)

day.description: The day to potentially fire (1-31, null to potentially fire every day)

month.description: The month to potentially fire (1-12, null to potentially fire every month)

limit.description: To limit how often to potentially fire a webhook, and maximum amount of records to send

times.description: The amount of records to send

seconds.description: The minimum amount of seconds between requests

includeCompanyDomain.description: If set to true, the company domain will be added to the header.

201.description: Webhook created, JSON output of webhook follows. Private key is included in the create webhook only!

monitorFields.description: A list of fields to monitor.

postFields.description: A list of fields to post to the webhook url. Field ID or alias: external name

additionalProperties.description: External name to post field to

url.description: The url the webhook should send data to.

format.description: The format the webhook should use (json, form-encoded).

frequency.description: How often the webhook could fire.

limit.description: To limit how often to potentially fire a webhook, and maximum amount of records to send

times.description: The amount of records to send

seconds.description: The minimum amount of seconds between requests

privateKey.description: The private key which can be used to verify that the webhook is secure (uses HMAC-SHA256)

includeCompanyDomain.description: If set to true, the company domain will be added to the header.

400.description: Provided JSON is bad, missing required fields, or mulitple access levels.

errors.error: Invalid request body

401.description: The user API key is invalid.

403.description: Permission violations in the fields selected.

errors.error: Permission denied to the following fields
Sorry for the inconvenience, please try again later or contact BambooHR.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The webhook ID to display details about.

postFields.description: A list of fields to post to the webhook url. Field ID or alias: external name

additionalProperties.description: External name to post field to

frequency.description: How often the webhook could fire.

times.description: The amount of records to send

seconds.description: The minimum amount of seconds between requests

delete.description: Delete a webhook that is tied to a specific user API Key.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: The subdomain used to access BambooHR. If you access BambooHR at https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, then the companyDomain is "mycompany"

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: {id} is an webhook ID that is associated with the User API key.

401.description: The user API key is invalid.

403.description: The API user key does not have permission to delete the requested webhook.

errors.error: You do not have access to webhook ID: 5

404.description: The webhook to be deleted doesn't exist.

errors.error: No webhook was found with ID: 7.
Sorry for the inconvenience, please try again later or contact BambooHR.

get.description: Get webhook logs for specific webhook id that is associated with the user API Key.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: The subdomain used to access BambooHR. If you access BambooHR at https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, then the companyDomain is "mycompany"

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The webhook ID to get logs about.

lastAttempted.description: timestamp of last time the webhook was sent

lastSuccess.description: timestamp of last time the webhook was sent successfully

failureCount.description: Count of how many times this call failed since last success

employeeIds.description: A list of employee ids that were changed.

403.description: The API user key is invalid, or does not have permission to see the requested webhook.

No webhook was found with ID: 7.
Sorry for the inconvenience, please try again later or contact BambooHR.

ListFieldValues.title: Add or Update Values for List Fields

note.description: A note to attach to the change in status

date.description: The date the request should be added in history. This will usually be the first date of the request. Should be in ISO8601 date format (YYYY-MM-DD).

timeOffRequestId.description: The ID of the time off request.

note.description: This is an optional note to show in history.

date.description: The date the adjustment should be added in history. Should be in ISO8601 date format (YYYY-MM-DD).

timeOffTypeId.description: The ID of the time off type to add a balance adjustment for.

amount.description: The number of hours/days to adjust the balance by.

note.description: This is an optional note to show in history.

name.description: The name of the company benefit plan.

slug.description: The unique identifier for the company benefit plan.

canBeAcaPlan.description: Can the company benefit plan be an ACA plan.

canCoExistEnrollment.description: Can the company benefit plan co-exist with an enrollment plan.

isReimbursementPlan.description: Is the company benefit plan a reimbursement plan.

filters.description: At least one filter is required

timeTrackingId.description: A unique identifier for the record. Use this ID to adjust or delete these hours. It can be any ID you use to track the record up to 36 characters in length. (i.e. UUID).

divisionId.description: [Optional] The ID of the division for the employee.

departmentId.description: [Optional] The ID of the department for the employee.

jobTitleId.description: [Optional] The ID of the job title for the employee.

payCode.description: [Optional] Only necessary if the payroll provider requires a pay code

dateHoursWorked.description: The date the hours were worked. Please use the ISO-8601 date format YYYY-MM-DD.

payRate.description: [Optional] The rate of pay. e.g. $15.00/hour should use 15.00 here. Only necessary if the payroll provider requires a pay rate.

rateType.description: The type of hours - regular or overtime. Please use either "REG" or "OT" here.

jobData.description: [Optional] A list of up to four 20 characters max job numbers in comma delimited format with no spaces.

timeTrackingId.description: A unique identifier for the record. Use this ID to adjust or delete these hours. It can be any ID you use to track the record up to 36 characters in length. (i.e. UUID).

divisionId.description: [Optional] The ID of the division for the employee.

departmentId.description: [Optional] The ID of the department for the employee.

jobTitleId.description: [Optional] The ID of the job title for the employee.

payCode.description: [Optional] Only necessary if the payroll provider requires a pay code

dateHoursWorked.description: The date the hours were worked. Please use the ISO-8601 date format YYYY-MM-DD.

payRate.description: [Optional] The rate of pay. e.g. $15.00/hour should use 15.00 here. Only necessary if the payroll provider requires a pay rate.

rateType.description: The type of hours - regular or overtime. Please use either "REG" or "OT" here.

jobData.description: [Optional] A list of up to four 20 characters max job numbers in comma delimited format with no spaces.

id.description: A unique identifier for the record. Use this ID to reference this goal.

alignsWithOptionId.description: The option ID that aligns with this goal.

sharedWithEmployeeIds.description: Employee IDs of employees with whom the goal is shared. All goal owners are considered "shared with".

dueDate.description: The goal due date in YYYY-mm-dd format.

completionDate.description: The date the goal was completed.

percentComplete.description: [Optional] The goal completion percentage (0 - 100). If completionDate is set, this value must be 100.

alignsWithOptionId.description: [Optional] The option ID that aligns with this goal.

sharedWithEmployeeIds.description: [Required] Employee IDs of employees with whom the goal is shared. All goal owners are considered "shared with". This must include the employee for whom the goal is created.

dueDate.description: [Required] The goal due date in YYYY-mm-dd format.

completionDate.description: [Optional] The date the goal was completed. If date is set, and no milestones are contained within this goal, percentComplete must be set to 100. If this goal does contain milestones, completion date cannot be set.

startValue.description: [Optional] Initial value of the milestone. Rounded to the nearest hundredth. If this value is set, endValue must also be set.

endValue.description: [Optional] End goal value for the milestone. Rounded to the nearest hundredth. If this value is set, startValue must also be set.

alignsWithOptionId.description: [Optional] The option ID that aligns with this goal.

sharedWithEmployeeIds.description: [Required] Employee IDs of employees with whom the goal is shared. All goal owners are considered "shared with". This must include the employee for whom the goal is created.

dueDate.description: [Required] The goal due date in YYYY-mm-dd format.

milestonesEnabled.description: [Optional] A flag indicating whether or not milestones are enabled for this goal. Setting this flag to false will delete all existing milestones for this goal.

deletedMilestoneIds.description: [Optional] Ids of all the milestones to be deleted with the update.

milestones.description: [Optional] All milestones to be added to the goal with this update.

startValue.description: [Optional] Initial value of the milestone. Rounded to the nearest hundredth. If this value is set, endValue must also be set.

endValue.description: [Optional] End goal value for the milestone. Rounded to the nearest hundredth. If this value is set, startValue must also be set.

startValue.description: [Optional] Initial value of the milestone. Rounded to the nearest hundredth. If this value is set, endValue must also be set.

endValue.description: [Optional] End goal value for the milestone. Rounded to the nearest hundredth. If this value is set, startValue must also be set.

renewable.description: If true, training will be renewed based off of frequency.

frequency.description: The frequency is the (optional) amount of months between renewing trainings. Not valid if training are not renewable.

dueFromHireDate.description: Number of days before the training is due for new hires. Not valid if training is not required.

linkUrl.description: Optional URL that can be included with a training.

id.description: The ID of the training record.

employeeId.description: The ID of the employee associated with the training.

completed.description: Completed is a date in the format yyyy-mm-dd.

notes.description: Notes left on the training record.

credits.description: What was credited for the training record.

hours.description: Hours associated with the training record.

cost.description: The currency and cost for the training record.
